maml:description.maml:para: Adds an administrative unit member.
The Add-AzureADAdministrativeUnitMember cmdlet adds an Active Directory administrative unit member.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are: * Continue
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the ID of an Active Directory administrative unit.
Specifies the unique ID of the specific Azure Active Directory object that will be assigned as owner/manager/member.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are: * Continue
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the ID of an Active Directory administrative unit.
Specifies the unique ID of the specific Azure Active Directory object that will be assigned as owner/manager/member.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a scoped role membership to an administrative unit.
The Add-AzureADScopedRoleMembership cmdlet adds a scoped role membership to an administrative unit.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the ID of an admininstrative unit.
Specifies the ID of an admininstrative unit.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: $User = Get-AzureADUser -SearchString "The user that will be an admin on this unit" $Role = Get-AzureADDirectoryRole | Where-Object -Property DisplayName -EQ -Value "User Account Administrator" $Unit = Get-AzureADAdministrativeUnit | Where-Object -Property DisplayName -Eq -Value "<The display name of the unit" $RoleMember = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.RoleMemberInfo $RoleMember.ObjectId = $User.ObjectID Add-AzureADScopedRoleMembership -ObjectId $unit.ObjectId -RoleObjectId $Role.ObjectId -RoleMemberInfo $RoleMember

dev:remarks.maml:para: This cmdlet returns the Scope role membership object:

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an administrative unit.
The Get-AzureADAdministrativeUnit cmdlet gets an Azure Active Directory administrative unit.

maml:Description.maml:para: If true, return all administrative units. If false, return the number of objects specified by the Top parameter
Specifies an oData v3.0 filter statement. This parameter filters which objects are returned.
For more information about oData v3.0 filter expressions, see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh169248%28v=nav.90%29.aspx
Specifies the maximum number of records to return.
If true, return all administrative units. If false, return the number of objects specified by the Top parameter
Specifies the ID of an administrative unit in Azure Active Directory.
If true, return all administrative units. If false, return the number of objects specified by the Top parameter
Specifies an oData v3.0 filter statement. This parameter filters which objects are returned.
For more information about oData v3.0 filter expressions, see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh169248%28v=nav.90%29.aspx
Specifies the ID of an administrative unit in Azure Active Directory.
Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a member of an administrative unit.
The Get-AzureADAdministrativeUnitMember cmdlet gets a member of an Active Directory administrative unit.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are: * Continue
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the ID of an administrative unit in Azure Active Directory.
If true, return all administrative unit members. If false, return the number of objects specified by the Top parameter
Specifies the maximum number of records to return.
Specifies how this cmdlet responds to an information event. The acceptable values for this parameter are: * Continue
Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the ID of an administrative unit in Azure Active Directory.
If true, return all administrative unit members. If false, return the number of objects specified by the Top parameter
Specifies the maximum number of records to return.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an administrative unit.
The Remove-AzureADAdministrativeUnit cmdlet removes an administrative unit from Azure Active Directory.

Specifies a variable in which to store an information event message.
Specifies the ID of an administrative unit in Active Directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a scoped role membership.
The Remove-AzureADScopedRoleMembership cmdlet removes a scoped role membership from Azure Active Directory (AD).

maml:description.maml:para: Updates an administrative unit.
The Set-AzureADAdministrativeUnit cmdlet updates an administrative unit in Azure Active Directory (AD).

Specifies the ID of an administrative unit in Azure AD.

maml:description.maml:para: Get an externalDomainFederation by external domain name.
The unique idenfier of an externalDomainFederation in Azure Active Directory
Boolean to express that return all results from the server for the specific query
The maximum number of records to return.
The oData v3.0 filter statement. Controls which objects are returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Gets an external domain federation setting for a given external domain.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets an external domain federation setting.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new externalDomainFederation in Azure Active Directory
The external domain you want to configure settings for.
Federation settings for the external domain.
$federationSettings = New-Object -TypeName Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.DomainFederationSettings
And finally you can pass this variable to the cmdlet:
New-AzureADExternalDomainFederation -FederationSettings $federationSettings ...
The unique idenfier of an externalDomainFederation in Azure Active Directory
The federation settings for the external domain.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Create a new external domain federation.
command:example.dev:code: $federationSettings = New-Object Microsoft.Open.AzureAD.Model.DomainFederationSettings $federationSettings.ActiveLogOnUri="https://adfs.com/adfs/ls" $federationSettings.IssuerUri = "http://adfs.com/adfs/services/trust" $federationSettings.LogOffUri = $federationSettings.ActiveLogOnUri $federationSettings.FederationBrandName = "Contoso Misa1 US" $federationSettings.MetadataExchangeUri="http://adfs.com/FederationMetadata.xml" $federationSettings.PassiveLogOnUri=$federationSettings.ActiveLogOnUri $federationSettings.PreferredAuthenticationProtocol="WsFed" $federationSettings.SigningCertificate="X509 signing public key" New-AzureADExternalFederationDomain -ExternalDomainName "adfs.com" -FederationSettings $federationSettings

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a new external federation domain settings.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete an externalDomainFederation by external domain name.
The unique idenfier of an externalDomainFederation in Azure Active Directory
The unique idenfier of an externalDomainFederation in Azure Active Directory
